The key principle here is that when you move around a circular path, completing a full circle returns you to your starting point and any additional steps taken will continue from there in a circular fashion. Mathematically, this means adding the number of steps moved to the initial position and then taking this sum modulo the total number of dots (or items) on the path to find the final position.

Again, thinking of moving left, \( (1 - 7) \% 20 = -6 \% 20 = 14 \), because moving left 7 steps from the first position brings us to the fourteenth position (remember, negative results are adjusted by adding the total number of dots until they fit within the range). The fourteenth item on the path is the green mamba.

Therefore, after following all these instructions, you will find yourself at the green mamba.
